description:
'''Saccharine Trust''' is an American [[punk rock]] band from [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], formed in 1980 by singer [[Jack Brewer (musician)|Jack Brewer]] and guitarist [[Joe Baiza]]. The band would frequently perform with [[SST Records|SST]] labelmates [[Minutemen (band)|Minutemen]] and [[Black Flag (band)|Black Flag]]. However, Baiza described Saccharine Trust as the "[[black sheep]]" of the SST roster. Drummer Rob Holzman appeared on their 1981 debut ''[[Paganicons]]'' but left the band to play in [[Slovenly (band)|Slovenly]], replaced by drummer Tony Cicero. After a ten-year hiatus circa 1986 to 1996, the band re-formed and began performing around the West Coast.

Baiza describes the band's sound as "poetry music" or "mini-theater."
